alert.note: Alert for Apache; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 11 at 2:05PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST/6 PM MDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Areas from Chinle southward to near St. Johns in central Apache and central Navajo counties. * WHEN...Until 500 PM MST /600 PM MDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 201 PM MST /301 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms over central Navajo and Apache counties. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tselani-Cottonwood, Sunrise Springs, Klagetoh, Cornfields, Greasewood Springs, Wide Ruins, Hubbell Trading Post National Historic Site, Burnside, Steamboat Canyon, Kinlichee Chapter House, Toyei, Chambers, White Cone, Nazlini, Petrified Forest National Park, Salina, Greasewood and Ganado. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 318 and 338. State Route 264 between mile markers 410 and 453. Highway 191 between mile markers 374 and 444. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
